Address: 440 E McCullough Dr #210, Charlotte, NC 28262, USA
Comments: Charlotte's most beautiful coffee shop hands down. If you’ve been to Haraz or Qahwah House, take everything that impresses you about their aesthetic and multiply it by two. This place is pristine. Regal. The decor is fully Turkish/Middle Eastern-inspired, with golden accents, vibrant colors, plants scattered throughout, and hanging bookshelves adorning the ceilings on the far ends. The walls are covered with stunning emblems and engravings, the spacious patio offers stylish lounge seating, and nearly every indoor chair is paired with an accented pillow that perfectly complements the surrounding tables' design and aesthetic. There's also a coffee bean tree-looking centerpiece that’s both unique and just straight-up cool. No other coffee shop in Charlotte matches this level of aesthetic. It’s new as of 2025, but when local influencers catch wind of it, they’re going to be all over it. They serve coffee, tea, food, pastries, some seriously good cheesecake, and more. Access to outlets can be tough though, so come charged up. There’s no way the owners of Haraz, Coffee Origin, and Qahwah House don’t know about this place, because they’re clearly all competing for the best Middle Eastern-style café in Charlotte. And as far as aesthetics go? This one wins.

Address: 440 E McCullough Dr #116, Charlotte, NC 28262, USA
Description: Casual, counter-serve outpost offering sandwiches & desserts plus bubble tea drinks in many flavors.
Comments: Lovely calming atmosphere, bright and floral aesthetic, great background music, friendly staff, unique bubble tea options and food. It's right by Vavela Cafe, which is amazing aesthetically, so definitely check that out as well.

Place: Charlotte Mecklenburg Library | University City Regional
Address: 5528 Waters Edge Village Drive, Charlotte, NC 28262, USA
Comments: New as of 2025 and gorgeous. Bright, open, and airy with wall-sized windows letting in tons of natural light. The second floor has a great views of the surrounding areas, plenty of seating with tons of outlets, and a good number of study rooms if you need quiet focus or a spot to take calls. You’ll see a lot of remote workers camped out on the second floor, while the first floor is more kid-focused, which works out perfectly. There’s plenty of space for everyone to enjoy without being on top of each other. Just an all-around beautiful library.

Address: 2749 Old Monroe Rd, Stallings, NC 28104, USA
Comments: Has a cozy, upscale cabin sort of aesthetic. Along with the usual options, they serve Turkish, Vietnamese, and Cuban-style coffee, plus flavors like butterscotch, blueberry, amaretto, and butter pecan. A moderate amount of seating, but it's compact. If anyone's having a conversation, everyone can hear them, making noise cancelling headphones a must if you're looking to study/work. Lots of cool Christian-themed art and inspirational quotes on the walls. It strikes a balance between feeling like an authentic local coffee shop while still having a modern touch in its design. Great spot. If you visit, also check out New Asia Market around the corner. Inside, there’s a quality Chinese food spot, and the store is packed with snacks, candies, spices, teas, and specialty foods from various Asian cultures—some of which you won’t even find at Super G Mart. A true hidden gem!

Address: 536 W Tremont Ave #102, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: The space has a sort of contemporary yet regal aesthetic to it. Teal walls with gold accents and warm colors on the furniture and decorations. It’s by an apartment complex, so while there’s free parking, the spots are almost always taken by residents. Paid street parking is available nearby though. There's a moderate amount of seating, including some outdoor options and a picnic table area belonging to the apartments but accessible to all. Summit Coffee is in general a great Charlotte local chain. They have a unique birthday cake cookie. It has frosting piled in the center rather than spread to the edges, so you have to eat your way to it, almost like a reward. They also offer more creative tea options than most coffee shops.

Address: 340 W Tremont Ave Suite 110, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: The aesthetic is pure “this would’ve been a great set for the Barbie  movie”.  Unapologetically feminine. In addition to sandwiches, they’re known for their Frosé, basically a slushie, but alcoholic (though they do have non-alcoholic options). They also serve coffee, tea, chips, and cold drinks, so a proper deli. There’s plenty of seating in the main area, plus more along the back wall with high tables and chairs. Outlet access is limited, so come charged up. Parking is free behind and along the sides of the building, but spots are limited. If you can't find one, paid street parking is available.

Address: 4612 Gilead St, Charlotte, NC 28217, USA
Comments: This is attached to a newer (as of 2025) apartment complex called Elan LoSo. It's giving "posh, elegant, modern". But say all those words in a French accent. A mix of crisp whites, natural greens with plants here and there, and gold accents on the light fixtures. Bravo to the interior designer of this place. The aesthetic is lovely. The upstairs area is part of the coffee shop, and it's a gem. It's small, only 3 seating options, but they've adorned the overhang with plants, there's a restroom, it's carpeted, and 2 of the 3 seating options have outlet access. The coziest of cozy nooks. If you can get an upstairs spot, good for you. Downstairs is nice as well, a few two-person tables, couches, and coffee bar seating with outlets. Parking is tight, it's around the corner in a garage, paid and 2-hour limited. But there's a few street spots (you'll have to parallel park) that are free and not time limited. They're usually taken by apartment residents though. Overall, a lovely coffee shop, just got to time your visit well. There's another Night Swim around the corner on Old Pineville Road that's bigger, so if you can't find a spot (or parking) here, mosey on over there.

Address: 901 Berryhill Rd, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA
Description: A family-run bakery founded by self-taught baker Cristina Rojas, also known as “The Batchmaker.” Inspired by her Honduran roots and a love for serving others, Cris crafts fresh cakes, brownies, cookies, and more—often paired with a cup of coffee sourced from her family’s farm. Drop by for a warm welcome, sweet treats, and a taste of home-baked goodness.
Comments: This comment is courtesy of a friend (shout out JL). Founded by a Honduran with a great story and a generous heart—they donate all leftover pastries to public servants like teachers, firefighters, and police. It’s small, dainty, and has a super feminine, dollhouse aesthetic with teacups galore. The coffee cake, Oreo cookies, and raisin cookies are all verified hits. Also, Platform Coffee + Kitchen is in the same area, giving you another solid third place within walking distance.

Address: 1031 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd suite b, Matthews, NC 28105, USA
Comments: The food here is great, the burgers, empanadas, and fries are all hits. The fries in particular are incredible, very crispy. Also, they at times provide two different cinnamon roll options, a butter cream icing and a traditional icing. Words can hardly express how deeply I appreciate that. I love this place. Seating is spread out, shouldn't be hard to find somewhere to sit even during peak hours, but access outlet can be challenging so come charged up.

Address: 1607 Montford Dr Suite C, Charlotte, NC 28209, USA
Comments: Aesthetic looks straight out of the Barbie movie. Extremely well done, clearly a lot of thought put into it. The owner is a wonderfully kind woman who opened the spot in fulfillment of a lifelong dream. She’s into the science of baking, going through recipe after recipe to get things right. She’s the only baker in Charlotte I’ve seen wait to apply icing to a cinnamon roll until after purchase to ensure it doesn’t dry out. Attention to detail 💯.

Address: 6259 South Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28217, USA
Comments: They have some really cool plant work going inside. The food is really good, particularly the breakfast flatbread and chicken/bacon sandwich, but seriously all the food is good. The vibes are as well. Limited outlet access though so come charged up.

Address: 2023 Beatties Ford Rd Suite D, Charlotte, NC 28216, USA
Comments: You could drop this spot right into Brooklyn and it'd fit right in. It's black owned, black themed, and very cool. The walls are decked with black history, culture, art, and icons. There's a live DJ sometimes playing music Mos Def would approve of. You can catch a group of Bernie Mac/Cedric the Entertainer brand old heads in here on some weekends in barbershop mode, just chilling. If Dr. Umar (iykyk) ever came to Charlotte this is where he'd want to hang out. Its unapologetically black. It's worth visiting just for the vibes. If you haven't caught on by now I—the creator of this site—am black—and proud!

Address: 210 E Trade St, Charlotte, NC 28202, USA
Description: A family-run, Black-owned coffee shop located in Uptown Charlotte’s Queen City Quarter. Serving coffee, specialty drinks, pastries, and light meals, it provides a welcoming space for people to gather and relax.
Comments: Great spot to grab some food/coffee, work, study, or just chill in a cozy environment. It has that true family vibe—don’t be surprised if the owner or a family member stops by for a friendly chat. The pastries, particularly the donuts, are incredible. That's because they source them from Beyond Amazing Donuts, another local black-owned business, and a favorite of mine (they have marvelous cinnamon rolls). That plus the laid-back atmosphere makes it a great place to hangout!

Address: 3102 Eastway Dr, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Comments: This place is so cool. Vintage vibes all around. It's attached to a video store that still sells VHS tapes, DVD's, and Blu Rays. The cafe is an extension of that, serving coffee, tea, hot food, pastries, and other snack like items. When you arrive, the big sign says "Visart Video" but that's not where you go in for the cafe. Go around the corner down the long walkway, you'll pass a bunch of tables and chairs. That's a good chunk of the seating, outside, but there’s additional seating indoors through a door you pass walking in. The indoor area has this dark room/film auteur sort of vibe. Movie posters all around, various art pieces, very cool. There's Wi-Fi it's just not named after the store, ask the staff for the details. This is a great place to hang out if it's warm, there’s outlets outdoors. It’s right by an awesome local bookstore, Book Buyers, so you can get your drinks, browse the video store, and then browse the book store, all within walking distance. The first time I visited, a dude had the indoors booked to propose to his girlfriend. She was elated, I suspect they met here. The ambience here is...lovely ❤️.

Address: 1218 East Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: If you’ve ever been to Brakeman’s in Matthews this is like that but within the city. It’s literally a home, so cozy, warm, friendly vibes to the max. The walls are covered in handwritten notes from customers over the years and drawings. You could spend a good hour just reading the walls and the stories that go with them. There’s limited parking behind the house but there’s a Harris Teeter across the street you can park at if it’s packed. Awesome, locally owned, down-to-earth spot.

Address: 919 Berryhill Rd #104, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA
Comments: They have cinnamon rolls sometimes 🔥. Parking can be tough during peak hours as there's a bunch of other businesses nearby. They've got some serious food options, so if you want a meal with your coffee/tea this is a good spot to hangout. Decent access to outlets if you sit on bench seating side. Very relaxed, bright, welcoming, atmosphere.

Place: Night Swim Coffee | Old Pineville Road
Address: 4500 Old Pineville Rd, Charlotte, NC 28217, USA
Comments: The cinnamon sugar bagel is very good, they give you a generous amount of cream cheese, almost too much, which is marvelous. They have a solid tea menu, not an overwhelming amount of choices, but the ones they have are a step above your standard tea options. If you order tea "for here," they serve it in a nice mug with a little glass pitcher for extra tea, a plate, and sometimes even a gold-colored spoon. Very quaint, very posh, very...demure?

Address: 2000 South Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Description: Contemporary spot serving high-end coffee drinks, plus tea & light fare like toasts & yogurt.
Comments: This has to be the biggest Not Just Coffee in the city. I grew up in Seattle, this spot reminds me of coffee shops over there. You've got a crowd of very cool looking young people, hipsters, and then your professionals, all on their laptops, working, drinking coffee, and pausing here and there to socialize. This is like the coffee shop capital of South End, it embodies the vibe of the neighborhood perfectly. I like the hot tea options they provide, more creative than your standard options.

Address: 333 Main St, Pineville, NC 28134, USA
Comments: This used to be the beloved spot Unwind Tea & Coffee before it was bought by Waterbean. The new Waterbean opened in the Fall of 2022, and while it doesn't have the same decor as Unwind, it maintains the respect the former had for tea. They have a shelf with at least 20 tea options in small demo canisters that you can pick up and smell to make your choice. The interior setup makes great use of the space, plenty of spots for individual seating plus a few larger tables for groups. It's always weird sitting at a table meant for four when you're just there to study or work on your laptop alone. You won't have that problem here. Great access to outlets, big windows that let in a lot of light, and a really good sandwich called the Waterbean Special, try it! I'm a regular here, it's one of my favorite spots in the city.

Address: 11318 N Community House Rd #202, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Comments: A standout among the many coffee shops and bakeries in Charlotte. While they don't have cinnamon rolls 😞, they have very unique cheesecakes that are worth trying. There always seems to be a few couples on dates here, and I can see why. It's got that cute, clean, minimalist aesthetic: all white with subtle pops of color, like a doctor's office but way cozier. The kind of interior that TikTok/Instagram influencers would love. It's also laptop friendly with solid outlet access and some small tables fit for one or two. I like that most of the seating is blocked by walls so that you can't see the order area. So when people are waiting in line, standing around, checking out the bakery, if you're seated you mostly can't see them. That's such a good interior design thing to me. Reducing visual clutter for guests that want to lounge about.

Address: 793 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120, USA
Description: Nestled in the heart of the community, Passion’s Café & Pastry is a cozy haven where locals and visitors alike come together to enjoy freshly brewed coffee and delectable pastries.
Comments: You know that hot pink and green crochet hook they sell at Sally Beauty that hairdressers use for braids? The aesthetic here reminds me of that, like the colors match almost exactly. This comment might only make sense if you’re black lol. My Mom braided my sisters hair so I saw that crochet hook a lot, and had to go fetch it plenty of times. The actual store is small but nice, lots of food options, and pastries. I couldn’t find Wi-Fi during my brief visit, but ask the staff if you go, maybe they have it. If they do, let me know via the Contribute page.

Address: 300 McGill Ave NW, Concord, NC 28027, USA
Description: At Mattie Ruth’s our mission is for every individual who walks in both new and regular customers, to leave as happy with their experience as they are with their coffee. We strive to make the space and community just as important as the coffee.
Comments: Very cozy, vintage aesthetic, slightly rustic, bohemian even, lots of art around. Everyone I've met that's been here talks about how sweet the staff is.

Address: 2520 South Blvd Suite 108-B, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: They're known for their croissants so definitely get one if you go. Small spot, maybe not ideal for an extended stay, but perfect for grabbing a bite and relaxing a bit. The staff here is incredibly kind. A coworker of mine got into an accident right in front of the store, and they came out to check on them, made sure they were okay, and gave them a free box of pastries. Truly run by great people!

Address: 2041 South Blvd Suite 105B, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: Great access to outlets, small but connected indoors to Tous les Jours so you’ve got more seating and pastry options nearby.

Address: 13880 E Independence Blvd, Indian Trail, NC 28079, USA
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: It’s Panera bread, you know what it is. Whatever you may think of them, they’re consistent with designing their stores as friendly places to hang out a while.

Address: 133 Indian Trail Rd, Indian Trail, NC 28079, USA
Comments: Stands out for having really healthy, organic, clean versions of everything you’d expect a coffee shop to have, plus food. Bright aesthetic, very good crepes, inviting atmosphere.

Address: 606 Indian Trail Road South, Indian Trail, NC 28079, USA
Comments: Warm, chill vibes. There’s a digital fireplace that I think is cool, gives the place a relaxing homey feel to it. Pretty calm throughout the day, there’s a good group of regulars but not the overwhelming rush you get at spots closer to the city.

Address: 1318 Pecan Ave, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Comments: Pristine vibes, immaculate aesthetic, very bright and airy. If you’ve been to Haraz Coffee House, this place is similar, but a lot bigger. It’s Yemeni owned, so the culture, coffee, and aesthetic of the shop reflects that in a beautiful way. The Khaliat Nahal (Honeycomb Bread) is incredible, it's somehow not as sweet as you'd think, but just sweet enough. Limited access to outlets so come charged up if you’re looking to hangout a while.

Address: 815 Providence Rd, Charlotte, NC 28207, USA
Comments: Coffee, tea, food, drinks, in a clean, bright, bubble gum sort of aesthetic space. Whoever designed the interior is good at designing interiors. My only criticism would be the limited access to outlets. The food is good, the staff is very nice. Free parking, but it can get tight during lunch hours.

Address: 100 W Worthington Ave Suite 107, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: Cool spot with similar vibes to Rhino Market, coffee, tea, food, bar, bakery, convenience store, all in one. However, this spot leans into being a proper restaurant as well, having a seated section with wait staff, silverware, etc. Very clean, modern, bright aesthetic. They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯 and other bakery items that they get from Amelie's. It's South End, so parking is tough. There are free options in the area if you drive around, but the garage attached to this spot is paid, and they don't validate parking. In their defense, South End is meant to be a walkable area. The idea is to take the light rail, walk around, shop, explore. So if you go, take some time to embrace a walkable Charlotte. There's all sorts of spots in this general area.

Address: 4350 Main St #109, Harrisburg, NC 28075, USA
Description: Espresso drinks, light fare & sweet treats offered in a modern, laid-back space with patio seating.

Address: 128 S Main St, Davidson, NC 28036, USA
Comments: Lauded by locals for having a welcoming atmosphere, a community hub for the area. Plenty of seating, they have an upstairs area and a lot of outdoor space in addition to the main floor. Davidson is a college town so plenty of students and staff hangout here to study and work. They have this birthday cake looking cookie where they put the frosting in the middle and don't spread it around. It's almost like they want you to eat your way to the frosting. It's a good cookie. They have nice tea options in addition to coffee.

Address: 2012 Bridgemill Dr Suite 100, Indian Land, SC 29707, USA
Comments: Bright modern space with a very calming feel to it. Lot's of plants inside, boosts the aesthetic. They've got plenty of stuff, food, hot and cold drinks including alcohol, bagels, and croissants. They've got this honey butter croissant that's immaculate. You'll want to check your blood sugar after eating it, but it's marvelous. Great interior setup in terms of seating that feels tucked away. Excellent access to outlets inside, and they have plenty of outdoor seating, with a few spots out there even having outlet access.

Address: 5040 State Hwy 49, Harrisburg, NC 28075, USA
Comments: Across all their locations, Sunflour Bakery has what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. The sandwiches are also good. Now, nothing here is cheap. You'll get like 2 things and spend $20, but it all tastes good, so it's worth the splurge every once in a while.

Address: 112 N Broome St, Waxhaw, NC 28173, USA
Comments: Literally a house, and a very cozy, quaint, homey one at that. Limited indoor seating but there’s more outside, including rocking chairs. Their espresso milkshakes are consistently called out in reviews as being good. They also offer pastries and local handmade products (gift shop style). They roast their own beans and have the tools on display inside the house, very cool set up. Great place to check out during a Waxhaw day trip.

Address: 5910 Waxhaw Hwy Suite D, Mineral Springs, NC 28108, USA
Comments: Quiet and inviting atmosphere that features coffee but also pastries, and most importantly, cinnamon rolls (👏🔥). They open early and close in the afternoons, so if you’re making a day trip from Charlotte, get up on time. It’s worth the trip. Waxhaw is around the corner so you can explore that area as well.

Address: 308 N Church St, Waxhaw, NC 28173, USA
Comments: In addition to food, pastries, drinks, tea, and standard coffee options, this place stands out for serving fresh Ethiopian coffee. If you’re into coffee, you should try it, Ethiopia is quite literally the birthplace of coffee. They have cinnamon rolls (💯🔥), and let you order them without icing, which is unique and a plus for those looking to indulge but skip a few calories. Very relaxed atmosphere. The space feels open, bright, modern, and clean—but not in that cookie-cutter, industrial-chic coffee shop way that’s become overdone. It’s got character of its own, with touches of Ethiopian culture throughout. Parking is a bit limited directly in front of the shop, but there’s free street parking nearby if you don’t mind a short walk.

Address: 1526 Providence Rd S #150, Waxhaw, NC 28173, USA
Comments: A bakery, café, and coffee shop all in one. Reviews frequently mention the pastries, muffins, smoothies, and chicken salad sandwiches as being great. Kid-friendly atmosphere, they have a small play area. Also, they have cinnamon rolls 👏🔥.

Address: 10828 Providence Rd #100, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Description: Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The store itself is large but the seating area is a small strip of tall chairs against a tall shelf like table running across the checkout area near the restrooms. There’s a microwave in the area to warm up food. Good low key spot in the sense that not many use the seating. Free Wi-Fi, access to everything sold in the store, not a bad setup at all.

Address: 5361 Ballantyne Commons Pkwy, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This is one of those where they put some effort into the interior design to make it inviting and bright. Excellent access to outlets from seating positions along the windows and walls, and even at the big table in the middle. Sits in a large shopping park with plenty of other things to check out.

Address: 121 W Main Ave, Gastonia, NC 28052, USA
Comments: A cozy storefront in downtown Gastonia, right in the heart of the old town, but with a fresh, modern vibe. Shares the space with Alchemy Coworking, who have plenty of additional seating, but require membership for access. The actual coffee shop's seating area is small but nice. Limited street parking right in front of the shop but there’s lots within walking distance. In addition to good coffee, the staff are known for being really nice here.

Address: 137 E Franklin Blvd, Gastonia, NC 28052, USA
Comments: A gift shop, roastery, spice store, and coffee shop all in one. Rustic, cozy, vintage, is how I'd describe this place. Free Wi-Fi, decent access to outlets, and a good selection of coffee and tea. I'll admit, it took some convincing to get me out to Gastonia, but its got its own charm. Worth a day trip to the area, after stopping here, you can go shop at the nearby Dillard's Clearance Center (the deals are real) if you're looking to update your wardrobe.

Place: Seoul Food Meat Company | South End
Address: 1400 S Church St a, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Description: A rustic hangout for Korean-inspired BBQ eats paired with Asian craft beers & custom cocktails.
Comments: Huge space, indoor and outdoor seating, plenty of food/drinks, and plenty to do, including karaoke. Parking is validated but you've got to download an app and get a code from a staff member (ask them for help if you're lost), and during peak hours it can be tough to find a spot. Seating next to outlets can be a challenge. The wings are really good here. Not social media hype good, I'm talking real life every day no hyperbole good.

Address: 100 N Tryon St, Charlotte, NC 28202, USA
Comments: A spacious, swanky atrium with marble floors, high ceilings, and plenty of natural light. It's connected to Bank of America, Blumenthal Performing Arts Center, and the Overstreet Mall. The 2024 redesign added tons of comfy seating and outlet towers so you can easily stay charged. There's several free Wi-Fi options (try another network if one acts up) and a Caribou Coffee for drinks and snacks. The downside is it's Uptown, so no free parking. I'd suggest parking in the Bank of America Corporate Center Garage—take the elevator to the 6th floor, and you’re inside Founders Hall. There's security guards everywhere, to the point where it's like "ayo calm down". They on every corner. You'll never feel safer than you will hanging out here. Upstairs near Caribou there’s a game room open to the public called The Lounge with ping pong, mini golf, a pool table, arcade games, and overpriced snacks. Around the corner from Caribou, you'll find a Post Office, a small library, and a path to the Overstreet Mall with more food options. You can explore most of Uptown indoors via the skywalks that connect the big buildings. This place is totally worth an Uptown day trip. Work/study then explore and go to an evening event (Hornets game, Middle C Jazz, Blumenthal show) to justify the price of parking.

Place: Seoul Food Meat Company | Mill District
Address: 421 E 26th St A, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Comments: Spacious with plenty of seating indoors and out. During the day, it’s easy to find a quiet corner. There’s a variety of food, drinks, desserts, and even an arcade with karaoke. The wings are seriously good. I'm not saying that flippantly they are actually really good. Right next to Urban District Market (same owners), it's a great remote work/study spot, though outlets are limited. The proximity (literally 30 second walk) makes it easy to switch between the two—park once, enjoy two solid options, both open late.

Address: 7922 Rea Rd, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: Very bright, large windows everywhere, lots of light to keep you energetic if you’re here to work or study. This is one of those with the big long table with outlets in the middle. Then there’s a handful of individual tables to the sides and lounge chairs. It’s in a large shopping complex in a rather ritzy part of town. There’s a Smashburger nearby 👀🔥. Do what you will with that information.

Address: 229 Main St, Fort Mill, SC 29715, USA
Comments: Sits in the historic downtown area of Fort Mill. Eclectic vibes. There are shelves around the store with arts and crafts and various trinkets created by locals. There’s also a piano anyone is welcome to play. Locally owned, serves as a gathering place for various groups, such as ceramics and knitting enthusiasts. Pretty compact space but they waste none of it. There’s a string of chairs near the piano with outlet access for those bringing their laptop. There’s limited parking right in front, for additional options, park in the Fort Mill Municipal Parking Lot down the street at the stoplight. It’s a short walk to the coffee shop.

Address: 6840 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd, Mint Hill, NC 28227, USA
Comments: Very nice, new, modern library. Moderate amount of seating, while the space itself, in terms of square footage, is about medium sized, the actual spots where adults (excluding the kids and teens zone) can sit down could be described as on the smaller side. Despite this, it’s a fine library, as is consistent across Charlotte-Mecklenburg branches.

Address: 900 S Fork Village Dr G4, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
Comments: In addition to coffee and pastries, they have a wonderful selection of teas from the family-owned and operated Piper & Leaf Tea Co in Alabama. Visit their website to learn more about their business story!

Address: 10020 Monroe Rd #180, Charlotte, NC 28270, USA
Description: As children of Vietnamese immigrant households, we have always been taught the value of food and its great meaning in our daily lives. Our love for Vietnamese cuisine is nurtured by time through the highs and the lows of our parents' cooking, which is why we founded 220C Banh Mi & Coffee as a place where everyone is welcome to hang out and enjoy Vietnamese food made with passion that is accumulated for many generations.
Comments: Small space but great aesthetic. The owners are Vietnamese so in addition to serving food, pastries, and coffee reflecting their culture, they’ve arranged the store the same. The sandwiches and pastries are really good. They have cinnamon rolls (💯🔥). They have hot or cold tea, the hot peach blossom is great. Limited access to outlets. The seating is compact, but it doesn’t get too crowded in the mornings, so come early to secure a spot.

Address: 104 W Charlotte Ave, Mt Holly, NC 28120, USA
Comments: They have various pastries, sometimes cinnamon rolls, but the cream cheese Danish they have regularly is fire. Has a small town rustic coffee shop aesthetic that's delightful. You don't have to park on the street, there's a lot behind the building that's free.

Address: 613 S Main St A, Mt Holly, NC 28120, USA
Comments: The coffee shop is the door on the left when you enter. Lots of seating, also lots of outlets, all somehow placed in slightly inconvenient locations (look above and below the windows). But at least they're there! It's Yemeni owned, the walls are covered in very well done art representing their culture. I think this location used to be a video store, so they did a marvelous job converting the space. There’s Wi-Fi, the password is the name of the store all lowercase, no spaces, and no s at the end of origin. The cheesecakes they sell are all marvelous. They put some bakery level effort into those things.

Address: 7 S Main St, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
Comments: Lots of food options, coffee, tea, pastries, and various market items for individual purchase. Parking is free but limited in terms of store dedicated spots. There’s additional Belmont downtown parking though. You might have to drive around a bit to find a spot if you go during peak hours, but Belmont is very walkable. I’d say walking around downtown Belmont to get here is a part of the attraction. There’s plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, although it’s popular enough to get crowded around lunch time. There’s a nice park and walking trail across the street. Limited access to outlets, but so long as you’re charged up, it’s a great place to hangout. Start here, eat, drink, then explore Belmont.

Address: 3541 Dewitt Ln, Charlotte, NC 28217, USA
Comments: Food, coffee, tea, and pastries in a good sized space. Limited access to outlets though, and parking can be tough, really tough. It’s free street parking but there’s so many other businesses in the area and apartments making it challenging to find a nearby spot. It’s worth toughing out though, the foods good, the staff is kind, they have large windows that let in a lot of light. Cool spot.

Address: 10110 Johnston Rd #5, Charlotte, NC 28210, USA
Description: Long-running store selling & trading a wide, regularly changing selection of books.
Comments: My favorite bookstore in Charlotte. Lot's of space, older building that feels lived-in, authentic. It even smells like a bookstore, idk how it just does. A very expansive book selection, and random chairs in the various corners and crevices so you can sit and read. Awesome place. I wouldn’t suggest going here to work, it’s a proper bookstore, the seating is individual without outlet access or nearby tables. Embrace the book vibes. Read.

Address: 12 Union St S, Concord, NC 28025, USA
Comments: The quintessential local bookstore. Connected indoors with Press & Porter Coffee, who in addition to great drinks, have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯.  Get a good book, grab a coffee, find a place to sit between the bookstore and coffee shop. Sounds like a good time to me, speaking from experience.

Address: 25 Market St SW, Concord, NC 28025, USA
Description: Good energy, local coffee, craft beer, and CATS, right in the heart of two beautiful historic districts in North Carolina: NoDa, Charlotte and Downtown Concord! Twelve adoptable cats roam the CAT LOUNGE - and they are ready to play! Our CAFE is separate and offers coffee, wine, craft beer and more!

Address: 1721 Sardis Rd N #7c, Charlotte, NC 28270, USA
Description: An independent bookstore in east Charlotte, offering a carefully curated selection of adult fiction and other genres.
Comments: Lovely little bookstore. Seating exists as a few tables and chairs by the front windows and a set of closely compacted couches. So not quite a remote work spot, but I encourage an embrace of literature. Leave your laptop behind and come here to read!

Address: 10500 Centrum Pkwy, Pineville, NC 28134, USA
Comments: Adjacent to the Super G Mart in Pineville (they’re connected inside). Large space with lots of food stalls, similar to Optimist Hall and Urban District Market, except all the spots are Asian food/culture focused. You can get coffee/tea from Tous les Jours inside Super G Mart or from Honeycow inside the actual hall. They have QR codes on the walls that allow you to order from any place within for pick up. Plenty of places to sit down, outdoor patio, free Wi-Fi, but limited access to outlets, so if you bring a laptop, come charged up.

Address: 15119 Bowl St, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Comments: Fly Kid Fly and The Salty offer free Wi-Fi, coffee, and limited indoor seating. The whole area is an outdoor marketplace with plenty of seating, stores, and spots to hangout.

Address: 100 N Tryon St Suite 270, Charlotte, NC 28202, USA
Description: Coffeehouse chain serving signature drinks, mochas & lattes, plus coffee & breakfast.
Comments: A great place to hangout enroute to exploring the Overstreet Mall. Work a bit from here, then hit the walkway around the corner (towards the post office and small library) to explore the rest of Uptown from indoors. Caribou has great sandwiches, and an extra large size for hot drinks that's larger than the Starbucks Venti. The tea's really good. This spot has limited inside seating, but there's a ton of seating outside in Founders Hall. This actual space is small, but the building its' in is huge. Founders Hall has a beautiful atrium and many seating options with great views of the city.

Address: 2157 West Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28208, USA
Comments: A small library with a big space for kids, limited general seating, but a nice space regardless. Very nice staff.

Address: 8635 Concord Mills Boulevard, Concord, NC 28027, USA
Comments: Beautifully designed interior. They have excellent tea options (Harney & Sons, one of the best around), coffee, and all sorts of sweet treats (their ice cream is particularly good).

Address: 8440 Pit Stop Ct NW #180, Concord, NC 28027, USA
Description: A friendly and welcoming tabletop game store for enthusiasts and novices alike.
Comments: A community submission. Located in a strip mall adjacent to Concord Mills. They also have beer and wine, plus a small snack shop. Check their website for tournaments and events.

Address: 1015 Providence Rd, Charlotte, NC 28207, USA
Description: Large supermarket chain with deli & bakery departments, plus health & beauty aids.
Comments: There's a Starbucks downstairs with a decent amount of seating, but what makes this a third place is the upstairs area with even more seating, a huge outdoor patio, and a bar. The outdoor patio is so large you can almost certainly always get a corner to yourself, but bring noise canceling headphones if you sit outside, it’s right above a busy street. The restrooms are upstairs making it convenient. Harris Teeter's is interesting in that some locations are just a grocery store, and others are like a grocery store and community hangout spot with a bar, hot food, Starbucks, plenty of seating, etc. This is the latter.

Address: 414 Tom Hall St, Fort Mill, SC 29715, USA
Comments: Good access to outlets along the wall. They have cinnamon rolls 👏🏾🔥. Modern coffee shop vibes in what looks like a converted space. There’s nice artwork on the walls from local artists you can buy to support them. They have unique tea options, the Organic Blue Ginger is particularly good.

Address: 300 Camp Rd, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA
Description: Food stalls, public art, shops & events in a complex once used as a car factory & military depot.
Comments: This is a large outdoor area with many indoor stores within its boundaries. You've got food, lot's of outdoor seating, outdoor Wi-Fi, Hex Coffee Shop on site if you want to chill indoors. There's all sorts of events happening here on a regular basis, check their website for more details.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
Description: The Trailhead Store is the on-site coffee house of the Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. It includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga.
Comments: A community submission. Located within the grounds of Daniel Stowe Botanical Gardens. You can work/study then explore the gardens and hiking trails. All seating is outside in a covered patio and then various fully outdoor seating options around the store (including a nice gazebo) and throughout the grounds of the gardens. So, a great option for a warm day.

Address: 6500 S New Hope Rd, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
Description: The Daniel Stowe Botanical Garden is a 25-year-old non-profit public garden with an on-site coffee house, the Trailhead Store, which does not require membership or admission to utilize. The Trailhead Store includes upstairs working space and a covered screened in porch that is popular with remote workers seeking a change of pace from working from home. The Trailhead Store also often hosts events free to the public, such as our Pickin' on the Porch music series and outdoor yoga. In the Garden we have many tables and areas you can work, relax, catch up with friends/family and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. We also have miles of trails on the property to enjoy which are also accessible without an admission fee.
Comments: A community submission. While the outdoor gardens themselves don't have Wi-Fi, the coffee shop on site called The Trailhead Store does. You can hangout from the shop, work, study, get something to drink, and then walk around the gardens. Sounds like a great day!

Address: 3701 N Davidson St Suite #203, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Description: An arts-focused craft brewery, lounge and performance space. Plenty of room for working alone or sprawling with friends. In addition to beer, has a wide variety of alternative beverages including house-made alcohol free drinks like craft sodas and caffeinated hop water.
Comments: A community submission, they have cinnamon sugar pretzels, so not quite cinnamon rolls, but just about the next best thing!

Address: 7 N Main St, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
Description: We are Belmont Bookshop, a community-focused bookshop and gathering space located on historic Main Street in Belmont, NC about 15 miles south of Charlotte in Gaston County. Come on in and stay a while!
Comments: A community submission. They have game nights, book clubs, space to hang out, coffee, alcohol, etc. It’s a proper small local bookstore, complete with the decor and trappings typically associated with such, as in it feels very authentic. The seating is mostly individual chairs interspersed throughout for easy sit & read access. There’s Wi-Fi but I think you’re better off enjoying the bookstore vibes here than trying to whip out your laptop and work (limited outlet access). There’s a lovely gentle dog that hangs around the shop sometimes as well. A good boy indeed.

Address: 159 Brumley Ave NE, Concord, NC 28025, USA
Comments: Huge space in a converted industrial building that’s shared with a thrift store. A quintessential example of the industrial chic aesthetic. I love it. The wooden floors creak as you walk around, there’s still a bit of that old building smell, very well done space. They managed to provide fairly good access to outlets with the redesign, although it’s not abundant, so charge your laptop before coming. Follow the signs if you’re struggling to find the entrance, it can get confusing as there’s also a brewery nearby.

Comments: Small but nice spot. Most of the seating is bar style chairs across a shelf like table across a wall. The food is good. There’s a rather large Goodwill nearby so if you’re into thrifting you can make it a whole trip.

104 S Main St #A, Huntersville, NC 28078, USA

Comments: Lots of tea options, coffee, food, and pastries in a small but bright and inviting space. Good access to outlets, most seating along the walls can access some. Has all the menu options and amenities of trendy new age coffee shops but keeps the homey local spot decor and atmosphere. A very clean place. Great music, perhaps that’s just a coincidence related to the playlist selected by the staff when I visited, but it twas 🔥. It’s small enough that everyone can hear your conversation if you’ve got a strong voice, so don’t come here to discuss super secrets, but it’s an excellent choice for working, studying, reading, meeting friends, chilling, etc. If you fancy a walk, a very nice trail, the Antiquity Greenway, is right down the street. You can grab your drink and head outside to touch grass.

Description: Upscale grocery store chain with an old-world vibe offers local produce, prepared eats, wine & more.
Comments: The seating section here is in a corner of the store by the checkout. This is a really nice neighborhood and fancy store, even fancier than Whole Foods. If you’ve ever been to Wegmans, it’s kind of on that level. The store itself is large but the seating section is medium sized. Free Wi-Fi, seating with good access to outlets, a microwave to warm up food you buy from the store, cinnamon rolls 🔥, restrooms right by the seating area, and coffee/tea (in front of the cold bistro meals case). This place is a low key gem.

Address: 8421 Davis Lake Pkwy, Charlotte, NC 28269, USA
Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

Address: 8 Union St S, Concord, NC 28025, USA
Comments: There's parking right behind the building and more in a nearby garage that serves all businesses in the area. They have cinnamon rolls 🔥💯. Sort of a fancy cabin aesthetic to the place. Doesn’t feel crowded, there’s enough space to spread out and feel comfortable, particularly on warm days as there’s plenty of outdoor seating. The door in the back that leads to the restrooms also takes you to Goldberry Books, so you can grab a drink, pick up a book, and have plenty of seating options between the two places.

Address: 1015 Seigle Ave, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Description: More than 30 arcade games headline this modern spot serving craft beers, cocktails & sodas.

Comments: There's a free parking lot down the street by the Pineville Police Department building. You will find your people here if you’re into D&D, Warhammer 40k, Yu-Gi-Oh, and the like. The store has a Discord (link on their website) where they organize meet ups and games. You can book the space anytime as well if you are looking for a place to host a game. They sell snacks, drinks, and beer, and there’s restaurants across the street, so you can grab food, bring it in, and stay for a while.

Address: 1030 Woodward Ave, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA
Comments: Plenty of space to spread out and find your corner. Limited outlet though so come charged up.

Address: 1824 N Brevard St, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA
Comments: Right across from a light rail stop, so easy access for those who live on the line and don’t want to drive here. It’s in the bottom of an apartment building, so plenty of traffic during peak hours. Parking is free if you can find a street spot, which might be tough given that  apartment residents and their guests usually have those spots. There’s a paid very small gravel lot nearby though. Excellent, like 10/10 Super Saiyan god level access to outlets. Very well designed. You can show up with your battery on E and you should be alright. The bagels are really good, and the hot tea options. I’m sure the coffee is as well, but I’m a tea guy.

Address: 2315 N Davidson St #300, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Comments: They have a mini market with a good selection of Korean foods and candies. The owner of the market is Korean, so there’s some inspiration from his culture throughout the market. See if you can find the Ritz Crackers with cream between them (like an Oreo, but with Ritz) in the store. I promise it tastes better than it sounds. There’s a coffee shop within the market in addition to plenty of food stalls. The tables have outlets embedded into them so you can stay charged up. Fast free wifi, check the napkin holders for the password. Great remote work spot.

Address: 1904 Matthews Township Pkwy, Matthews, NC 28105, USA
Description: Counter-serve bakery/cafe chain serving sandwiches, salads & more, known for its bread & free WiFi.
Comments: I think Panera is overpriced and the food is middling at best but the interior set up and organization as a place to read, study, or work remotely remains excellent across most all their locations, this one included. Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable.

Address: 139 E Main St, Rock Hill, SC 29730, USA
10215 Mcintyre Rdg Rd #100, Pineville, NC 28134, USA
Description: Cheery regional coffeehouse chain serving specialty drinks, smoothies & baked goods.
Comments: I’d say this is most similar to a small Caribou Coffee. Coffee, tea, food, pastries, and a drive thru. This location is new (as of 2024) and very clean as a result. Also, I'm like 70% sure they get their sandwiches from the same place as Caribou Coffee, they're great. Not a ton of seating, so if you drive here and can't find a spot, drive up the street to the Pineville Library or Waterbean Pineville for more options.

1108 Cherry Rd, Rock Hill, SC 29732, USA
153 E White St, Rock Hill, SC 29730, USA
Comments: The coffee shop is really a side piece to the massive shop with cool trinkets and gifts and a folksy sort of vibe. Going here can be a whole day trip because it’s also within walking distance of Knowledge Perk, Rock Hill Coffee, Amelie’s Rock Hill, and all sorts of shops. If you go here to work, end your day at Fountain Park. Bring a book and a nice drink. You’ll feel like you’re in a movie, one of those they used to always cast Drew Barrymore in.

Place: Knowledge Perk Coffee Company | Fort Mill
Address: 900 Crossroads Plaza, Fort Mill, SC 29708, USA
Comments: The cinnamon rolls. My friend, the cinnamon rolls, they are exceptional. They only have a limited amount, usually available in the morning until they’re sold out, but the cinnamon rolls are marvelous. If you're able to withstand feelings of gluttony or social anxiety stemming from the thought that the barista is judging you (they're not), order two. Eat one right away, warm the other one up when you get home. That's how to properly evaluate a cinnamon roll. You must have it in both states, as each is valid in its own right.

Address: 7201 Matthews-Mint Hill Rd, Mint Hill, NC 28227, USA
Comments: Sits in a converted house with plenty of seating across the indoor and outdoor areas. It’s a similar vibe to Brakeman’s in Matthews. Has that homey community gathering spot feel, in part because it’s literally in a home, but also because they host plenty of events and gatherings for various groups in the area. Customers and staff alike look very relaxed, at home even, here. There’s sufficient spots near outlets for remote workers and plenty of parking behind the house. They have cinnamon rolls, not the cute bite sized kind, proper fully formed cream cheese frosting cinnamon rolls, and they are sublime.

Address: 2151 Hawkins St, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Description: Bustling taproom & beer garden offering in-house sandwiches & international food-truck fare.
Comments: Gigantic space. Two floors and extends into an even larger foyer area. Coffee shop downstairs during the day. An abundance of places to sit, some having outlet access. Biggest drawback is paid parking, but that’s a South End challenge in general.

Address: 14825 Ballantyne Village Way Suite 135, Charlotte, NC 28277, USA
Comments: Lot's of food and pastry options that all look great. Not a ton of seating though, most of it is upstairs and it's a compact space with limited access to outlets. If you come here to work/study and can't find seat, whip around the corner to the Panera Bread nearby which is large, you'll certainly find seating. Or the Sunflour Bakery (my favorite of all their locations), Summit Coffee, and Starbucks all in the same area. Ballantyne has it's own third place thing going on.

Comments: Small but charming.

Comments: In the Latta Arcade business center, so plenty of other great attractions nearby for making this a trip. It is super small, seating for maybe 5-6 people indoors, but plenty of outdoor seating because of the business center. Food options galore in addition to getting a drink here.

Address: 2041 South Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: Small but connected indoors to SipCha Bubble Tea, so you have more drinks and seating options. Friendly staff.

Address: 35 N Main St, Belmont, NC 28012, USA
3611 Mt Holly-Huntersville Rd #201, Charlotte, NC 28216, USA
Comments: Small space but they make good use of it to fit seating. They have small cubicle style areas near the back where you can work/study, but they’re paid spaces. So paid mini co-working spaces, can’t just pop into one. But they also have limited general seating in the front of the store that’s open to all. They have coffee, tea, treats (ice cream, pastries), and a bar. They have cinnamon rolls that they get from Sam’s club, cream cheese frosting. I know this because I’m plugged into the cinnamon roll scene of greater Charlotte. It’s something of an area of expertise for me. They’re marvelous cinnamon rolls, better warm, but amazing regardless. They’ve got some unique tea options, sourced locally.

Address: 1204 Central Ave #100, Charlotte, NC 28204, USA
Comments: Immaculate vibes. One of the few places open later so if you need to really get some work done or study, this is a good place to hangout.

Comments: The SouthPark location is one of my favorite spots in the city, but this one is alright. Small but serviceable.

Address: 1414 S Tryon St, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Comments: This is inside a larger office/retail building that has plenty of seating in the lobby area. If you go in the morning, get the French Toast, it’s good.

Description: Cool deli for eclectic sandwiches & a market with beer, wine & readymade pastas, plus local breads.

Comments: Good access to outlets, deli style food, convenience store, coffee and tea, bar, solid amount of seating indoors and outdoors. Great spot. Parking is free, there's more in the garage behind the building if you can't find something right in front. The SouthPark location is still my favorite, but there's no bad Rhino Market!

Address: 2101 Central Ave, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
13501 S Tryon St, Charlotte, NC 28278, USA
515 Jordan Pl, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Comments: They have what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. I suggest getting two, eat one right away, and save the other for eating at home after warming it up. As a general rule, I’d encourage you to refrain from offering your opinion about a cinnamon roll until you’ve had it both cold and warm. Things can taste rather different heated up, flavors coming out, for better or worse. They can sell out of cinnamon rolls pretty quickly sometimes though, if you show up after like 11 AM, no guarantees. The sandwiches are also pretty good. Be warned though, the whole menu is expensive. Like, I’ll go in here and buy 2 things and get asked for $28 and be just flabbergasted. But the cinnamon rolls, they wash it all away. So it’s worth it. The gigantic rice krispy treat they have sometimes also slaps.

Address: 380 S College St, Charlotte, NC 28202, USA
Description: This cheerful gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This place is huge. You have the entry level with plenty of seating, but also an upstairs that can easily seat 30 people and a downstairs (that’s sometimes blocked off for private events) that can fit a good chunk of people as well. The only thing about Uptown is if you're driving, you'll have to pay for parking. But if you're on the rail trail or walking distance, definitely make the trek over here.

Address: 2135 Southend Dr #109, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Description: Daytime hangout serving a simple menu of pastries, sandwiches & coffee made using local ingredients.

Address: 201 Camp Rd Suite 103, Charlotte, NC 28206, USA
Description: Stylish coffee bar offering pour-overs, cold brew & espresso, tea, food, and baked goods.
Comments: This is in Camp North End, parking is free in the large lot back  . They have some really fancy named teas and they’re all incredible. If you get it “for here”, they give you a nice cup and this fancy kettle pot thing to pour it from. The food is good, they give you a lot of it for the price. It’s not small cute coffee shop meals, it’s a full restaurant style plate of food. They have orange flavored cinnamon rolls sometimes 🔥💯. Lots of windows, gives the place a bright/energetic feel. Excellent access to outlets as well. Great music playlist, good vibes. Awesome day trip for remote workers, Camp North End has a lot to explore. Start at Hex, walk around after work, and end at Heist Brewery. Solid day.

Address: 4300 Congress St, Charlotte, NC 28209, USA
Comments: Great spot to work from during the day. Only gets crowded during lunch, but even then there's a lot of seating indoors and outdoors so you can almost always find a spot. Tea, coffee, deli, and a convenience store inside. S-tier remote work spot. Everything you need is there. It becomes a bar in the evenings (or early afternoon for the day drinkers). If you sit at the bar, there’s outlets underneath the table. They're open until 9 or 10 PM most days.

Address: 932 Seigle Ave, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Description: Change Please is where social enterprise and coffee expertise blend. Comments: They have what I consider to be the best cinnamon rolls in Charlotte. I suggest getting two, eat one right away, and save the other for eating at home after warming it up. As a general rule, I’d encourage you to refrain from offering your opinion about a cinnamon roll until you’ve had it both cold and warm. Things can taste rather different heated up, flavors coming out, for better or worse. They can sell out of cinnamon rolls pretty quickly sometimes though, if you show up after like 11 AM, no guarantees. The sandwiches are also pretty good. Be warned though, the whole menu is expensive. Like, I’ll go in here and buy 2 things and get asked for $28 and be just flabbergasted. But the cinnamon rolls, they wash it all away. So it’s worth it. The gigantic rice krispy treat they have sometimes also slaps.

It's a common recommendation among remote workers and students in Charlotte for good reason. The vibes. The vibes are A+. They have cronuts. Comments: Lots of seating, great sandwiches, coffee, a bar, various convenience store offerings. Eclectic, punk sort of vibes in terms of aesthetic. Feels lived in, authentic. You'll see plenty of remote workers on their laptops during the day. When you make a deli order, they ask your name then announce it over a loudspeaker when its ready. Gave me grade school nostalgia, being called to the office. Good luck if you have a tough name, I use a simplified version of mine to avoid embarrassment. The biggest challenge here is outlet access, so come charged up.

The convenience store has a wider selection of random snacks and drinks than a gas station typically would have, which I appreciate. Parking is free behind the store but limited, especially during peak hours.

Address: 235 W Tremont Ave, Charlotte, NC 28203, USA
Description: Popular spot offering draft brews & deli sandwiches amid a convenience store, plus outdoor seating.
Comments: This place is spacious, with indoor and outdoor seating on the main floor, plus an upstairs area with more seating and a small patio. Very alt-punk/rock aesthetic, which I personally love—I grew up in Seattle. It feels like the kind of spot the crew from a 2000s coming-of-age film (the ones who get bullied by the popular kids and listen to Radiohead, Dashboard Confessional, and Yellowcard) would hang out, talking through their trauma and how much they want to "get out of this town." And I mean that in the best way possible (I may have just listed some of my favorite bands). This place is awesome. The music is on point. I don’t even bother with headphones unless it’s packed. Truly a standout when it comes to vibes. A heads-up: there’s some access to outlets upstairs, but not a lot, so come charged up. If you’re a morning person, you can practically have the whole place to yourself if you show up early. It doesn’t get busy until the afternoon. Parking is the biggest challenge—there’s free parking near the store, but it’s limited. Street parking and nearby lots are options, though not always free. South End is designed for walking and light rail access, which is great unless you’re coming from another neighborhood and need your car. Not complaining though, just making a note.

Parking is free in the angled spots in front of the store but time limited (2 hours). There's paid lots in the area if you want to stay a while. There's a Common Market within walking distance, great spot for lunch, and also to hangout when it's warm outside, plenty of outdoor seating.

Also, they have cinnamon rolls, and they’re quite alright. Nothing remarkable, but certainly passable. This location gets a lot of traffic during lunchtime from the nearby office park but is mostly chill after that. It’s across the street from Summit Coffee SouthPark and Tous Les Jours SouthPark and Rhino Market SouthPark so if you drive to this area, you have options.

Address: 6701 Carnegie Blvd, Charlotte, NC 28211, USA
Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This is inside a very large Harris Teeter, but it's on the list because there's a good amount of seating, including a covered patio/outdoors spot. Go get some food from the hot bar, then head in here, get your drink, and hangout.

Address: 4805 Sharon Rd, Charlotte, NC 28210, USA
Description: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.
Comments: This spot has an upstairs section that gives a cool sense of seclusion. It's the only Starbucks I know of in Charlotte with an upstairs. Whole Foods is right around the corner, so if you drive to this area, you've got options.

Address: 157 E Main St, Rock Hill, SC 29730, USA
Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This whole area of town has several third places all within walking distance. You could drive, park, and spend a day walking between this Amelie's, The Mercantile, Rock Hill Coffee, and Knowledge Perk. It's worth the drive if you're in Charlotte and haven't gone down to Rock Hill yet. Finish your day at Fountain Park for nice views and a calm relaxing atmosphere. Bring a book!

Address: 136 E 36th St, Charlotte, NC 28205, USA
Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: This isn't the original Amelie's if you've been in Charlotte long enough to remember that. They moved, so this is the new "original" in a way. The interior design is better than the original, it's bigger, the seating is arranged such that there's plenty of spots for 1-2 people to sit that are out of the way of the bigger tables. The food might be overpriced but I don't go for the food. I'm there for vibes. The vibes are great.

Address: 7715 Pineville-Matthews Rd Unit 34B, Charlotte, NC 28226, USA
Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: Seating by outlets at this location can be a little tricky here so come with a full charge. Other than that, as is consistent across all Amelie's, it's a great place to hangout and read, work, study, chill, etc.

Address: 524 Brandywine Rd, Charlotte, NC 28209, USA
Description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.
Comments: One of my favorites. Large space, plenty of seating, excellent, and I mean excellent, organization of seating nearby outlets. There's a raised seating area featuring a row of booth-style seats along the wall. Beneath the padded backs, you'll find a discreet black strip with outlets available for use. They’re easy to overlook, but they’re there! If you frequent this location, as I do, you'll see the same people a lot. Working, reading, studying, etc. Great way to make friends if you're new to the city. Food, pastries (cinnamon rolls🔥) coffee, tea (pro tip, you can get a whole pot of tea. Just ask. It's not on the displayed menu, but it's on the menu). Everything you need to stay a while.
